item.p:
Write out (in words!) a sequence of steps to describe what the function
w(t) = {{w}}^{ {{p}} }\left( {{omega}} t \right)
does to an input t (in radians).
Use a calculator and your answer to the previous item to evaluate w( {{tstar_disp}} ). Round your answer to 4 decimal places.
Step2. Compute {{w}} of the result of Step1.
Step3. Raise the result of Step2 to the power of {{p}}.

Write out (in words!) a sequence of steps to describe what the function
z(t) = {{w}}\left( {{omega}} t^{ {{p}} } \right)
does to an input t (in radians).
Use a calculator and your answer to the previous item to evaluate z( {{tstar_disp}} ). Round your answer to 4 decimal places.
Step1. Raise t to the power of {{p}} .
Step2. Multiply the result of Step1 by {{omega}} .
Step3. Compute {{w}} of the result of Step2.
